job_title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT in Lawrence, MA
pros: PTO, co-workers , Community based
cons:
Toxic 
Management didn't care about employees. If a patient was rude, or threatening they took the patients side. 
Security is a joke
They would deny vacation time even if you'd earned your hours. 
They didn't care if you were mentally or emotionally exhausted by the job.
Bonuses were hung over your head all year to either get a little one or none. 
You'll never be a 5 on there employee ratings even if you do go above and beyond. 
I knew what I was doing I stayed late my techs respected me, and I was pretty good with patients. When I have myself a 5 justified it even my manager agreed they denied it.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Lawrence, MA
pros: Hours are flexible, rotating weekends and holidays. Great people do work with.
cons: Can get stressful at times

pros: You got to know who your patients are, made connections with them and it's a very rewarding job.
cons: There are people who are doing under the table jobs, INSIDE the clinic, which makes them look very unprofessional. People who I worked with selling things inside the job, against the policy. They give you a 6 weeks PROBATION time, and the trainees treat you terribly, they don't teach you anything but the drama going on inside the clinic, so bad that they eventually get YOU involve somehow. That place is a joke, got payed 12.00 per hour to do extra jobs that we aren't supposed to do, getting attitude not from the patients BUT from the staff members. You clearly don't grow in the industry, if they don't like one thing you do, they dispose you like garbage. Management doesn't do anything to address these issues, I know because I worked there. Training is useless because my trainee didn't let me do hands on and watch me, so I did not learn a thing. This place is worst than an emergency room, for 12.00 dollars per hour is not worth it, and to deal with the pointless drama is not worth it either.

pros:
-Working in a community that truly needs accessible healthcare and services. Patients are great overall.
-Most providers are knowledgeable, love their patients, and want to give the highest quality care
-Clinical staff WANT to do the right thing
cons:
The review that mentions "warm body syndrome" is spot on. Management is terrible at all levels. There is a serious lack of respect for all clinical staff.  Absolute ignorance of problems that are mentioned constantly. Zero continuing education provided.  No place for advancement.

All clinical staff is VERY underpaid, but what they pay MAs is insulting. There are NO YEARLY RAISES-  bonuses cannot make up for this, especially when management is constantly threatening to withhold bonuses if staff doesn't meet arbitrary standards set by them. Upper management, on the other hand, takes home hundreds of thousands of dollars every year while simultaneously preaching about how we need to see more and more patients in less and less time to be able to keep budgets on track.

Don't work here unless you have no other option. In that case, get some experience then get out quickly.

review_title: Organization has many areas of successes; other areas for improvement (committing to goals and committing to ALL staff)
pros: Working for a mission-driven organization.  Working with a high performing team of middle managers.
cons: The organization lacks commitment to following through on plans and goals it lays out for itself.  It struggles with maintaining high expectations for staff (doctors, nurses, health educators, administrative, senior management, all across the board) and oftentimes accepts mediocre performance.  The organization gets off track from its goals and commitment to patients and staff because it has a small organization mentality (can be a positive sometimes, but it gets in the way of performance), but it is a large organization.

review_title: Poorly managed, only care about the bottom line, knowingly place patients' lives at risk.
pros:
Diverse patient population. 
Good benefits with ample time off. 
Potential to have a flexible schedule (depending on job type and site).
cons:
Horrific management and administration. 
Warm body syndrome - they hire people into positions just to have them filled regardless of experience or qualifications. 
Patients regularly wait 1+ hours for their appointment and receive substandard care. 
No room for growth. No CEUs given to nursing staff. 
Drama! Drama! Drama! Worse than high school!
Not patient centered (don't let them fool you).

pros: I was able to get my DEA And MA Drug License
cons: Unreliable employer. Posible unsupportive for people in the military. I was hired and then fired before I even started working. I feel sorry for the underserved population having to deal with this type of health care management. I can not help them if I am not allowed.

review_title: Great place to see what community healthcare is like under the new delivery model. This is Obama care.
pros: Providers and staff really care about patients and they do their best to provide the best care with the available resources.
cons: Only those who are independently wealthy can afford to work there long-term. It is truly non-for-profit, unless you're the CEO or you play golf with the CEO.
